intro: Myosotis scorpiurus, commonly known as the scorpion's tail forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling the shape of a scorpion's tail. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces seed capsules that release tiny seeds when mature. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with medicinal and ornamental value.
